definitions.definition: A psychiatric diagnosis denoting a persistent , often chronic , mental illness characterised by abnormal perception , thinking , behavior and emotion , often marked by delusions .
A condition in which a person is supposed to have several distinct personalities ; dissociative identity disorder .
Any condition in which disparate or mutually exclusive activities coexist ; a lack of decision between options.

main_definition: ( pathology ) A psychiatric diagnosis denoting a persistent , often chronic , mental illness characterised by abnormal perception , thinking , behavior and emotion , often marked by delusions . [from 20th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( now deprecated ) A condition in which a person is supposed to have several distinct personalities ; dissociative identity disorder . [from 20th c.]
( informal , figurative ) Any condition in which disparate or mutually exclusive activities coexist ; a lack of decision between options. [from 20th c.]
